events.eventName: Join Us At Lone Mountain Park!
events.eventDescription: This is a group for parents of children who may be struggling with friendships. Our group is based on acceptance and tolerance. We will have get-togethers and play dates to enhance social skills, foster friendships for our children, and have fun! I have started this group because I have an energetic 8 year old, who often times feels left out by her peers due in part to her ADHD. If you have a child who may be feeling left out because of something they have little to no control over, join us! Let's help our children learn and grow together

events.groupDescription:
There are almost 6,000 children in the foster care system in Virginia. These children have been neglected and abused by those meant to love and care for them.

When they're taken out of these dire circumstances, they are placed in loving foster homes. Right now the need for homes is great.

Join us to learn more about becoming a foster parent and see how you can help a child in need of love.

events.eventName: Learn About Becomming A Foster Parent
events.summary: Informational gathering describing the programs in your area.
events.eventDescription:
There are almost 6,000 children in the foster care system in Virginia. These children have been neglected and abused by those meant to love and care for them.

events.groupName: Fostering Peace, Love, Learning & Each Other
events.groupDescription: This group is about how together we can ALL foster a better world.   We are teachers, learners, parents and children (including--but NOT limited to--former, present and future foster parents and children), thinkers, doers, dreamers
events.eventDescription: I know you all have already done a million things to make the world a better place, or at least one or two, and we'd like to hear about it! Everyone will have 5-7 minutes to share their story. We will also share change we'd like to create in the future!

events.groupDescription: Parenting is rewarding, fun and the most amazing and important role we will play in our lives. But, it is also not easy. One way to think of it is, how we can best 'perfect the art of imperfect parenting.' I am an advocate of positive parenting that is rooted in a values-based and play-based approach.
events.eventName: Little Artists at Large! Art and Socialise Session
events.eventDescription: This 2-hr art exploration and social session is for toddlers aged 2 - 4 years of age. We'll start by some free play and introduction to each other with songs, and reading a story book. This is followed by the art session, where we will create art and end off with snacks, music and close.
